They are designed to be fired out of a canister which propels them to a desired range after fire is initiated by an onboard fuse - either electrical or impact sensitive. The fuse will initiate the charge by fusing into the explosive shell plates to either create a burst of explosive charges or one large charge. = = = Relationship to modern amphibians = = = 
The common name for Diplocaulus ("twisting") is "dippy".  Dippy is thought to be related to Diplocyclosaurus (or Diplocaulus).  Diplocaulus evolved as two forms; one which walked on land like animals we see today, the other which lived in the water.  It is believed that if more species of Diplocaulus (or Diplocyclos) were found they may have a more diverse range that the current forms.  Dippy is also thought to have had limbs that may have swum in water like the modern amphibian, the salamander

Can you explain the concept of context switching in the Linux process scheduling? How is context switching used to keep track of a running program?
In computer science, context switching is a technique used in computer operating systems and embedded systems to keep track of the state of multiple execution contexts when they are interrupted or preempted.Its purpose is to save as much information as possible, and the minimal amount of context to allow to quickly re-establish the same state. Context switching, like CPU switching, is performed by the hardware.

What are some practical tips for parents to implement mindful practices during mealtime with their family?  
When it comes to mealtime, I suggest sitting down together as a family and sharing your day, even if it was only a short day. A child will be much more interested in a good story if it's told in the context of something that happened, such as a trip to the zoo or a family outing. If there is already tension in the family, sitting down quietly and sharing a story with one another is difficult. The CSS Jackson was the first ironclad warship to be built in the Confederacy, a ship intended to be the flagship of the Confederate submarine fleet. Du Fu's compassion, for himself and for others, was part of his general broadening of the scope of poetry : he devoted many works to topics which had previously been considered unsuitable for poetic treatment. Zhang Jie wrote that for Du Fu, " everything in this world is poetry ", Du wrote extensively on subjects such as domestic life, calligraphy, paintings, animals, and other poems. 
Du Fu also felt that poetry should be socially relevant. 
In his poetry, Du used strong language and imagery ( as in " The River Flowing Beyond Chun Yang " ). His poems expressed his deep hatred for corruption, the arrogance of officials, greed, poverty, and other social evils.  The poet Zhou Zhi wrote, " Only Du knew the way to treat the social issues in his poetry which would be painful to the people.

The French floating batteries were deployed in 1855 as a supplement to the wooden steam battle fleet in the Crimean War. The role of the battery was to assist unarmored mortar and gunboats bombarding shore fortifications. The French used three of their ironclad batteries ( Lave, Tonnante and Dévastation ) in 1855 against the defenses at the Battle of Kinburn on the Black Sea, where they were effective against Russian shore defences. They would later be used again during the Italian war in the Adriatic in 1859. The British floating batteries Glatton and Meteor arrived too late in the war. The British also had three land based ironclad warships, HMS Bulldog, Devastation and Aetna. The British and the French also equipped their ironclad warships with floating batteries, which in the case of France were often referred to as bataillons flottants ( floating battalions ). A floating battery is a battery of guns mounted on a floating platform. The main difference between land batteries and floating batteries is that land batteries are stationary and can be dug into the ground while floating batteries are located on ships or floating barges that can be moved to areas of potential action

The most basal group of temnospondyls is the superfamily Edopoidea. Edopoids have several primitive or plesiomorphic features, including a single occipital condyle and a bone called the intertemporal that is absent in other temnospondyls. Edopoids include the Late Carboniferous genus Edops and the family Cochleosauridae. Dendrerpetontidae has also been included in Edopoidea, and is the oldest known temnospondyl family. Balanerpeton woodi is the oldest species, having been present over 330 million years ago during the Early Carboniferous. B. woodi had an eulimboid skull morphology and no intertemporal bones. Like early temnospondyls, B. woodi had a simple dentition lacking premolars, and its teeth were placed in transversely elongated rows. Balanerpetoid teeth are typically conical or plicated, rather than having the flattened shapes of later temnospondyls.

Originally, temnospondyls were classified according to the structure of their vertebrae. Early forms, with complex vertebrae consisting of a number of separate elements, were placed in the suborder Rachitomi, and large Triassic aquatic forms with simpler vertebrae were placed in the suborder Stereospondyli. With the recent growth of phylogenetics, this classification is no longer viable. The basic rhachitomous condition is found in many primitive tetrapods, and is not unique to one group of temnospondyls. Moreover, the distinction between rhachitomous and stereospondylous vertebrae is not a clearcut one ; rather, it involves a continuum of variation. This fact means that a distinction must be made between " rhachitomi " in a strict sense, and a broader taxon containing many of the taxa considered as stereospondyls under previous classification. What group of animals is the question about their evolution?
A. the evolutionary tree of the earth
B. humans
C. temnosponadlys
D. their origins
Answer: D

Generate according to: After a rainstorm have you ever noticed puddles in the road with glossy-looking oil floating on top? Ever noticed the oil spots that sometimes form in your chicken-noodle soup? Ever notice how Reeko occasionally writes ‘lead ins’ to the experiments that have absolutely nothing at all to do with the experiment?
Why does the oil float on the water rather than mixing with it? This experiment will take some of the mystery out of this phenomenon.
Take a jar of water and put a drop of food coloring in the jar. Take out some oil and put it into another jar of water (I know, I know.. gross.. but that’s what it’s for). Observe the jar with the oil for a minute and watch the oil float on top of the water. Now take the water you just stained bright green and pour it into the jar with the floating oil. Watch the oil and water slowly but surely mix. Now, pour some of the oil out and repeat this process all three times and you’ll get the idea. Oil is not soluble in water. Now that you know that, take up next week’s experiment.
